italian.name: Authentic Spaghetti Carbonara
italian.description: A classic Roman pasta dish made with eggs, cheese, pancetta, and black pepper.
instructions: Bring a large pot of salted water to boil and cook spaghetti according to package directions.
While pasta cooks, dice pancetta and cook in a large skillet until crispy.
In a bowl, whisk together eggs and grated cheese.
Reserve 1 cup of pasta water, then drain pasta.
Remove skillet from heat, add pasta to pancetta.
Quickly stir in egg mixture, adding pasta water to create a creamy sauce.
Season generously with black pepper and serve immediately.

italian.name: Pizza Margherita
italian.description: Simple and delicious pizza with tomato sauce, mozzarella, and fresh basil.
instructions: Preheat oven to 475°F (245°C).
Roll out pizza dough on a floured surface.
Spread crushed tomatoes over dough, leaving a border.
Tear mozzarella and distribute over sauce.
Drizzle with olive oil, season with salt and pepper.
Bake for 12-15 minutes until crust is golden.
Top with fresh basil leaves and serve hot.

asian.name: Pad Thai
asian.description: Thailand's famous stir-fried noodle dish with a perfect balance of sweet, sour, and savory.
instructions: Soak rice noodles in warm water for 20 minutes.
Mix fish sauce, tamarind paste, and sugar for the sauce.
Heat wok, scramble eggs and set aside.
Stir-fry shrimp or tofu until cooked.
Add drained noodles and sauce, toss until coated.
Add eggs back, stir in bean sprouts.
Serve with peanuts, lime, and green onions.

asian.name: Tonkotsu Ramen
asian.description: Rich, creamy Japanese pork bone broth with tender noodles and toppings.
instructions: Simmer pork bones for 12 hours to create rich broth (or use 2 hours with pressure cooker).
Strain broth and season with soy sauce and sesame oil.
Cook ramen noodles according to package directions.
Prepare soft-boiled eggs and slice pork belly.
Grill pork belly until crispy.
Assemble bowls with noodles, pour hot broth over them.
Top with pork belly, soft-boiled eggs, green onions, and nori.
Serve immediately while hot.

desserts.name: Chocolate Lava Cake
desserts.description: Decadent individual chocolate cakes with a molten center.
instructions: Preheat oven to 425°F (220°C).
Melt chocolate and butter together.
Whisk eggs, egg yolks, and sugar until thick.
Fold in melted chocolate mixture.
Sift in flour and fold gently.
Grease ramekins with butter and dust with cocoa powder.
Pour batter into ramekins, filling 3/4 full.
Bake for 12-14 minutes until edges are set but center is soft.
Let cool for 1 minute, then invert onto plates.
Serve immediately with ice cream or whipped cream.

desserts.name: New York Cheesecake
desserts.description: Classic creamy cheesecake with a graham cracker crust.
instructions: Preheat oven to 325°F (165°C).
Mix graham cracker crumbs with melted butter.
Press mixture into bottom of 9-inch springform pan.
Beat cream cheese until smooth.
Add sugar and beat until fluffy.
Add eggs one at a time, beating after each addition.
Mix in vanilla and sour cream.
Pour filling over crust.
Bake for 50-60 minutes until center is almost set.
Turn off oven and leave cheesecake inside for 1 hour.
Refrigerate for at least 4 hours before serving.

healthy.name: Buddha Bowl
healthy.description: Nutritious bowl with quinoa, roasted vegetables, and tahini dressing.
instructions: Cook quinoa according to package directions.
Toss sweet potato cubes with olive oil, salt, and pepper.
Roast sweet potato at 400°F (200°C) for 25 minutes.
In the last 10 minutes, add chickpeas to the baking sheet.
Massage kale with a bit of lemon juice and olive oil.
Make tahini dressing by mixing tahini, lemon juice, and water.
Assemble bowls with quinoa as base.
Top with roasted vegetables, kale, and avocado.
Drizzle with tahini dressing and serve.

healthy.name: Grilled Salmon with Asparagus
healthy.description: Heart-healthy grilled salmon with roasted asparagus and lemon.
instructions: Preheat grill or grill pan to medium-high heat.
Season salmon with salt, pepper, and minced garlic.
Drizzle salmon with olive oil.
Trim asparagus and toss with olive oil, salt, and pepper.
Grill salmon skin-side down for 4-5 minutes.
Flip and cook for another 3-4 minutes until done.
Grill asparagus for 5-7 minutes, turning occasionally.
Serve salmon and asparagus with lemon wedges and fresh dill.

comfort.name: Creamy Mac and Cheese
comfort.description: The ultimate comfort food with a rich, creamy cheese sauce.
instructions: Cook macaroni according to package directions, drain.
In a large pot, melt butter over medium heat.
Whisk in flour to create a roux, cook for 1 minute.
Gradually add milk, whisking constantly until smooth.
Bring to a simmer and cook until thickened.
Remove from heat and stir in cheeses until melted.
Season with salt and pepper.
Add cooked macaroni and stir to coat.
Optional: Transfer to baking dish, top with breadcrumbs, and broil until golden.

comfort.name: Homemade Chicken Soup
comfort.description: Warming chicken soup with vegetables and noodles.
instructions: In a large pot, add chicken broth and bring to a boil.
Add chicken breast, reduce heat and simmer for 20 minutes.
Remove chicken, shred it, and set aside.
In the same pot, add carrots, celery, onion, and garlic.
Add bay leaves and simmer for 15 minutes until vegetables are tender.
Add egg noodles and cook according to package directions.
Return shredded chicken to the pot.
Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Remove bay leaves and garnish with fresh parsley before serving.

quick.name: Cheese Quesadilla
quick.description: Quick and easy quesadilla with melted cheese and optional fillings.
instructions: Heat a skillet over medium heat.
Place one tortilla in the skillet.
Sprinkle cheese evenly over the tortilla.
Add any optional fillings if desired.
Top with second tortilla.
Cook for 2-3 minutes until bottom is golden.
Flip and cook for another 2-3 minutes.
Remove from heat and cut into wedges.
Serve with sour cream and salsa.

quick.name: Veggie Omelette
quick.description: Fluffy omelette filled with fresh vegetables.
instructions: Beat eggs with milk, salt, and pepper.
Heat butter in a non-stick skillet over medium heat.
Add bell peppers and mushrooms, sauté for 2 minutes.
Pour egg mixture over vegetables.
Cook without stirring until edges start to set.
Gently lift edges to let uncooked egg flow underneath.
When almost set, sprinkle cheese on one half.
Fold omelette in half and cook for another minute.
Slide onto plate and serve immediately.
